data.title: Duke University Athletics Archives
data.text:
Affiliation: Duke University Athletics

Owned and operated by Duke Recreation and Physical Education, Cohan Fields boasts two turf fields. Turf Fields 1 and 2 total 34,650 sq. ft. each.

Two turf fields totaling 34,650 sq. ft.

Affiliation: Duke University Athletics

Located on the East Campus of Duke University since the fall of 2017, the Duke Softball Stadium is home to the newest addition to the Blue Devils athletics family, the Duke softball program. The dimensions of the field stretch 190 feet down the lines and 220 feet to center field. The stadium includes three indoor batting cages, a locker room, a team room, an athletic training area, conference room and a press box that features separate booths for radio crews, TV crews and working media.

Home to the Duke Blue Devils softball team

Seating for 500 with additional lawn spaces

Affiliation: Duke University Athletics

Opened in 2015, Morris Williams Track and Field Stadium is located on the west side of Kennedy Tower, sharing the press box with Koskinen Stadium, and is the home to Duke Track and Field. The track features an eight-lane, BSS 1000 track surface, constructed by Beynon Sports.

Home to Duke Blue Devils track & field teams

8-lane Beynon track

Dual long/triple jump runways & dual pole vault runways.

Seating for 500

Affiliation: Duke University Athletics

Card Gym is located on Duke’s West Campus adjacent to the Wilson Recreation Center. The building opened in 1955 and serves as a practice facility for varsity sports, Sport Clubs and has hosted the ACC Fencing Tournament. Card Gym operating hours are in conjunction with the Wilson Recreation Center.

2 basketball/volleyball wood floor courts

6 badminton courts

Affiliation: Duke University Athletics

Completed in 2000, Sheffield Indoor Tennis Stadium features six courts, offices for the coaches, a hall of fame room and locker rooms. It was awarded the 2000 United States Tennis Association Outstanding Tennis Facility.

Home to the Duke Blue Devils tennis teams

Six varsity tennis courts

Affiliation: Duke University Athletics

Opened in 2003, Ambler Tennis Stadium is an 11,000-square-foot outdoor tennis facility features seating for 700 around Duke‘s six outdoor varsity courts and a state-of-the-art sound and electronics system.

Home to the Duke University Blue Devil tennis teams

Six lighted varsity tennis courts

Seating for 700

Affiliation: Duke University Athletics

Completed in 1996 and renovated in 2011, the turf field was primarily built for the Duke field hockey program. Williams Field at Jack Katz Stadium features one of the best watering systems in the country, a state-of-the-art sound system and a new scoreboard.

Home to the Duke University Blue Devils Field Hockey team

Site of the 2014 and 2022 ACC Field Hockey Championship

Affiliation: Duke University Athletics

The beautiful 18-hole championship Duke University Golf Club opened in 1957 and is a course designed by Robert Trent Jones, Sr. It has under gone numerous renovations including most recently adding the Karcher-Ingram Golf Center.

Located on the campus of Duke University and home to the Duke University Blue Devils golf teams

The course has also received top rankings from Golf Digest, GolfWeek, Golf Magazine and the Zagat Survey, and was recently voted as the best public course in the Triangle by the Triangle Business Journal

The site of the 2001 NCAA Men’s Golf Championship and is considered one of the top 10 golf courses in North Carolina

Affiliation: Duke University Athletics
